summary: An email from an FBI Special Agent in the New York Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking squad requesting signature on a Continued Presence application for an Epstein victim, indicating ongoing victim support efforts in 2020.

persons.name: SSA
persons.context: Author of the email requesting signature on a Continued Presence application for an Epstein victim, working in Squad C-20 Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking at the FBI New York office.

events.title: Continued Presence Application Request
events.description: An FBI Special Agent emails about needing a signature on a Continued Presence application for one of Jeffrey Epstein's victims, indicating ongoing victim support and immigration-related assistance.

keyFacts: The FBI was processing a Continued Presence application for an Epstein victim as of July 2020, indicating ongoing victim support years after Epstein's death.
Continued Presence is a temporary immigration status available to victims of human trafficking, suggesting the victim may have been cooperating with law enforcement.
The email shows coordination within the FBI's Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking squad regarding Epstein case victims.
The document references an unnamed Epstein victim who was receiving assistance from federal authorities.
